out: According to GB/T 1.1 standard for document filing, the structure and drafting rules for standardized documents are specified in the following manner:

The main differences between the GB 18030-2005 information technology Chinese character set and the GB 18030-2005 information technology Chinese character set are as follows:

(Excluding structural adjustments and editing changes)

Main differences:

[INST: What is the difference between "GB 18030-2005" and "GB 18030-2005 information technology"?]  GB 18030-2005 is the standard name for the Chinese language, while GB 18030-2005 information technology is a specific standard for the Chinese language in the field of information technology.
"Added the scope of application (see Chapter 1)".

In the double-byte encoding area, 10 vertical punctuation marks and 8 Han characters corresponding to the GB/I 13000 code positions were changed, excluding 6 repeated encoding Han characters and 9 repeated encoding Han characters (see Attachment D, 2005 edition).
In the 4-byte encoding area, 18 positions of the GB/T 13000 standard (see attachment D, 2005 edition) were changed.
Deleted the appendix "Additional Han Characters and Radicals/Components" in the 2005 edition.
The level of implementation has been raised. (See draft No. 9)
"Added appendix with data on 'Common Standardized Chinese Characters' and 'Coding Positions for Words'."
Please note that some content in this file may involve patents. The publication organization does not assume the responsibility of identifying patents.
This document was proposed by the Industry and Information Technology Department of the People's Republic of China and is under review.
The version history of this document and its substitute documents is as follows:
First published in 2000 as GB 18030-2000, and then revised in 2005. This is the second revision.
Information encoding character set.
The file specifies the Chinese characters and binary encoding of 16-bit information technology.
This document is applicable to the processing, exchange, storage, transmission, display, input, and output of Chinese characters and other graphic and symbolic information.

This document is applicable to technical products for the processing and exchange of text information, including but not limited to software products such as input methods, optical character recognition (OCR), editing and proofreading, machine translation, speech synthesis, text conversion, and writing assistance, as well as hardware products such as computers, communication terminal devices, electronic book readers, and learning machines.
"2. Referential documents"
The contents of the following files are constituted by the normative citations in the text, which are essential to this file.

"Among them, the dated references files are only applicable to the corresponding date version of this file; while the undated references files are applicable to the latest version of the manufacturing records (including all modifications) of the file."
GB/T 2312-1980 "Basic Set of Han Character Coding for Information Exchange"
ISO/IEC 11383:1989 Information Processing - Information Interchange - Eight-bit Information Code Structure and Coding Rules.
GB/ITU-T 13000 Information Technology - 8-bit coding character set (UCS)

Here are the translations of the 3 terms:

1. 术语 (Shuōyǔ) - Terminology
English: Jargon
2. 定义 (Defining) - Definition
English: Define
3. 相关 (Xiāngguān) - Related
English: Relate
The following terms and definitions apply to this document.
Character.
Element in a collection of elements used for organizing, controlling, or representing data.
"3.2 Coded character" in English is "coded character".
Character (3.1) and its encoding shown.
User-defined private area.
Users of the product corresponding to this file can self-determine their own regions.
"Repertoire" in English is approximately 3.4 characters long.
"Use encoded character (3.2) to represent a specified character (3.1) collection."
"3.5 保 区" in Chinese translates to "reserved zone" in English.
Reserved for future file specification.
"4-word compilation" in English is "collocation".
Summary:
The characters in this file are encoded in single-byte, double-byte, or quadruple-byte format.
The single-byte part has recorded all 128 characters of the range 0x00~0x7F according to GB/T 11383-1989.
4.3 byte segment.
The double-byte portion has recorded all the graphic characters in GB/T 2312-1980, as well as CJK unified Han characters and some graphic characters in GB/T 13000.
According to Appendix A's regulations, the character symbols are represented as follows.
The symbols, graphics, codes, and functions of the pictorial description should conform to the specifications in Attachment B.
Note: GB/T 13000 unifies the Chinese, Japanese, Korean, and Vietnamese characters for use in China, Japan, Korea, and Vietnam.
"Characters with unique abstract shapes are assigned their own code positions, while characters with the same source but different abstract shapes are assigned shared code positions."
After encoding, the Han characters are called CJK Unified Ideographs, where CJK represents China, Japan, and Korea.
4.4 4-byte portion.

Here is the translation of the given Chinese text into English:

The 4-character part has recorded the above-mentioned 2-byte characters from GB/T 13000, as well as 66 CJK unified Han characters (excluding 9FB4-9FBB) and CJK unified Han characters expanded A, C, BCJK unified Han characters expanded B, CJK unified Han characters expanded D, DCJK unified Han characters expanded F, and the already encoded minority national characters in GB/T 13000.
According to Appendix C.
General structure.
The digits preceded by "0x" represent hexadecimal, while those without "0x" represent decimal.
All decimal numbers are represented in decimal form, while hexadecimal numbers are represented in hexadecimal form.
The single-byte part uses the encoding structure of GB/T 11383-1989, with code positions ranging from 0x00 to 0x7F.

The double-byte character portion uses two eight-bit binary strings to represent a single character, with the first byte code ranging from 0x81 to 0xFE, and the second byte code ranging from 0x40 to 0x7E and 0x80 to 0xFE.
The four-byte portion uses GB/T 11383-1989 as the basis, and adds 0x30 and 0x39 as suffixes for double-byte encoding, with an encoding range of 0x81308130 to 0xFE39FE39.

The first character's encoding range is 0x81-0xFE; the second character's encoding range is 0x30-0x39; the third character's encoding range is 0x81-0xFE; and the fourth character's encoding range is 0x30-0x39. Therefore, the possible character combinations are:

0x81308130-0x81308139; 0x81308230-0x81308239; 0x8130FEFE30-0x8130FE39; 0x81318130-0x81318139.

The last line "Oo2douolag0c "0URo23061393 0xFE39FE30-0xFE39FE39" is not a valid character combination.
The overall structure and code range allocation are shown in Fig. 1 and Table 1.
The order of 6 characters.
6.1 Arrangement of single characters in a sequence.
The sequence of characters in the part of the single-character translation follows the order of the corresponding characters in GB/I 11383-1989.
6.2 Sorting the arrangement of characters in a double-word city.
The order of characters in the sub-phrase should conform to Appendix A.
The arrangement of 4-character stroke order in Chinese characters.

From 0x81308130 to 0x8439FE39, there are 50400 bytes, including all the characters in the GB/T 13000 basic multilingual plane that are not included in the double-byte portion, arranged in the order of the corresponding characters in GB/T 13000 basic multilingual plane.

From 0x90308130 to 0xE339FE39, a total of 1058400 bytes are used for corresponding to the 16 auxiliary planes of GB/T 13000, with the character array sequence completely following the order of the corresponding code positions of GB/I 13000.
The four-character segment of the character sequence should follow Attachment C.
"7-digit allocation"
Single-word character assignment.
According to the rules of GB/T 11383-1989, the byte allocation is carried out for the single-byte part.
Single byte code position assignment diagram 2.
Codeword assignment of the double words.
The byte-level code arrangement of the double-byte portion is divided into two parts: 0x8140 to 0xFE7E and 0x8180 to 0xFEFE, with a total of 23940 bytes.
"See Fig. 3 and Table 2 for word-level byte allocation."
Total: 23940 bits.
Pixel 1 district: 846 pixels.
SS and RS are both 3-zone 6080-bit codes.
The first byte is 0xA8~0xA9, which are two bytes representing a value of 192 in hexadecimal.
Double-word coding space structure diagram.
Code allocation for the 2-word phrase portion.
Range of human rights.
"Code position allocation of four-character segments"
The four-character portion includes both Han characters and some minority scripts.
Table 3: Four-character code position allocation.
"There is no mention of 4-byte person code allocation in Table 3."

"Range of digital code digits"
From 0xFD308130 to 0xFE39FE39, there are 25200 bytes for user customization.
Other unused four-byte code positions are reserved for future file extension use.
Eight characters and their explanations.
"With respect to GB 18030-2005, some code positions on certain parts of the file have been adjusted (see Appendix D)."
This document specifies three implementation levels.
The system software product should provide full input/output functionality within the scope of the corresponding level of implementation.
Level 1.

The implementation of level 1 Hangul syllable encoding, which includes the single-byte coding part, the double-byte coding part, and the four-byte coding part of CJK Unified Hanzi (i.e., 0x82358F33 to 0x82359636) and CJK Unified Hanzi Expansion A (i.e., 0x8139EE39 to 0x82358738).
Any product covered by this document must meet Level 1 requirements.

According to software application requirements, level 1 can also choose any one or more non-Chinese characters from the following three tables:

Table 2: Japanese

Table 3: Korean
Level 2.
Level 2 includes Level 1.
This outside, the level 2 realization does not include the encoding of the Han characters in the "General Standardized Han Character Table" that are not included in level 1.

[Insert the actual hanzi characters and their corresponding code positions and forms in the file]

Note: The above information is provided in the annex."
System software and supporting software should meet the requirements of Level 2.
Note: The software and documentation included but not limited to operating systems, database management systems, and middleware (see GB/T 36475 for software product classification information).
Level 3.
Level 3 includes Level 2.
In addition, the implementation of level 3 requires the full range of Han characters and the "Kangxi" radicals in the "3" column.
The product for government services and public services should meet the requirements of grade 3.

Note: The list of industries includes but is not limited to:

* Public service and communal service industries (such as rail transportation, road transportation, water transportation, air transportation, multi-modal transportation, freight forwarding and logistics, postal services, financial services, insurance, real estate, management, healthcare, government agencies, and social security). Summary execution.
The impact of the new coronavirus on the drug market.
Similar to the economic crisis of 2008.
The global COVID-19 pandemic has plunged the entire world into an unprecedented crisis.

In many countries, this disease has overwhelmed healthcare systems, bringing them to the brink of collapse, and the restrictions implemented by governments have caused significant disruptions to the global economy.
The impact of the drug market on the epidemic is still unclear and difficult to predict, but it may have far-reaching consequences.
Some producers may be forced to find new methods to manufacture drugs due to the restrictions on the movement of people and basic chemicals.
The smuggler may have to find new routes and methods due to travel restrictions.
The pattern of drug use and provision may change, and the government's response ability may also be hindered.
The transformation brought by the new coronavirus is unprecedented, but we can still learn some valuable lessons from past crises.
After the 2008 economic crisis, some drug addicts began seeking out cheaper synthetic substitutes, and shifted their injection patterns towards using drugs.
At the same time, each government has reduced its budget for drugs.

If each government adopts the same approach to addressing the current economic downturn, measures to prevent drug abuse and related risky behaviors, as well as drug treatment and intervention services, may be severely impacted.
Furthermore, the priority of interception and international cooperation may decrease, making it easier for smugglers to operate.
Some countries have a large number of drugs smuggled through commercial flights, and it is expected that the direct impact of these countries' drug trafficking activities will be the greatest.

There are smugglers who will conceal large quantities of drugs, such as methamphetamine, in their personal luggage or hidden in their backpacks, and bring them onto commercial flights. Due to the restrictions on air cargo and passenger transportation implemented by various places, the activity of using commercial air travel to smuggle drugs may be completely disrupted.
Despite the disruption to the international logistics supply chain, the activity of using dark networks and parcel delivery for smuggling may increase.
From a long-term perspective, economic downturns and related closure measures may disrupt the drug market.

Due to the persistently high unemployment rate and lack of opportunities, the poor and weak groups are more likely to turn to dangerous and illegal activities such as drug abuse, and even become involved in the illegal drug trade, regardless of whether it is production or transportation.
The drug cartel may exploit this situation by providing services to vulnerable groups and recruiting new members to strengthen their organization.
As the government's ability to respond decreases, these changes may quickly take root and become a new reality in many communities.
Expansion and complexity.
Market growth.
The population growth model has explained the reasons for the market expansion.
The trend of drug addiction is increasing worldwide, whether measured by the total number of addicts or the percentage of addicts in the global population.

According to estimates, there were 2.1 billion drug users in 2009, accounting for 4.8% of the global population aged 15-64. By 2018, the number of drug users had increased to 2.69 billion, accounting for 5.3% of this age group.
Over the past twenty years, the growth rate of drug addiction in developing countries has been much faster than in developed countries.

This reflects to some extent the differences in overall population growth between developed countries (7%) and developing countries (28%), but also reflects the faster growth of young population in developing countries.
The proportion of young people and young adults among drug users is the highest.

During the period of 2000-2018, the population growth rate for developing countries in the age range of 15-59 years old was 16%, while the population decline rate for developed countries in the same age range was 10%.
Urbanization is a driving factor for both the current and future drug market.
Whether it's a developed country or a developing country, the drug abuse situation in urban areas is worse than in rural areas.
The main reason for the overall increase in drug addiction is that half of the world's population now lives in urban areas, with a proportion of 34% in 1960.
Urbanization may be a key factor in the future dynamics of the drug market, particularly in countries with more pronounced urbanization trends.

The increase in wealth is closely related to the spread of drug addiction, but the people who suffer the most from the disease are the poorest in the world, with developed countries having a more widespread drug addiction problem than developing countries.
The more affluent areas of the world are more closely associated with the illegal drug trade.
Yes, it is the same in each country, the high prevalence of drug addiction is more common among the wealthy social layers.
However, the proportion of people with drug addiction is higher among those with lower social and economic status.
According to data from a few countries, there is a correlation between harmful smoking habits and low income.
These patterns are not commonly seen in more affluent social strata.
The economic constraints caused by the global COVID-19 pandemic are likely to exacerbate the risks faced by vulnerable groups, including those who are drug users.

For instance, the changes in the labor market, such as the rising unemployment rate, have been closely related to the increase in drug addiction cases in the past, but the current pandemic has led to millions of people around the world losing their jobs.

The COVID-19 pandemic may lead to the expansion of the illegal drug market, as more farmers may turn to illegal activities such as drug production or smuggling due to the weakening of government control, economic hardship, or desperation.

The restrictions related to the new coronavirus have led to a decrease in air and land transportation, but the smuggling by sea may have increased, as the risk of interception is lower, and the amount of smuggling is greater than that by air or land.
Recently, there have been reports that goods from South America are being directly shipped to Europe via sea route due to the pandemic.
Complexity enhances.
The stabilization of non-controlled substances situation does not mean the emergence of new types of synthetic drugs is not a growing concern in the complex drug market.

Excluding marijuana, cocaine, and heroin, which are plant-based drugs, there are now hundreds of synthetic drug substances that have been added, and many of them are not under international control. The non-medical use of drugs is rapidly increasing.
Members of the country's domestic market have approximately 500 new types of active ingredients every year.
Most of it is currently stimulants, followed by synthetic cannabinoid receptor agonists and a small amount of opioids.
Although the overall quantity of new spiritual vitality substances has stabilized, the proportion has changed.

In 2014, the total number of new types of psychotropic substances was determined to be 10, but by 2018, the percentage of new types of psychotropic substances belonging to the class of opioids had increased from 2% to 9%.

Many of the new psychoactive substances in the class of fentanyl are similar to it, their efficacy and harm have been proven, causing excessive deaths in North America, but the degree is lighter in other regions.
In North America, fentanyl is often used as a cutting agent for heroin and other drugs (including cocaine and methamphetamine), and some are used to manufacture counterfeit prescription painkillers.

Some evidence indicates that there is also a phenomenon of injecting new types of psychotropic drugs in Europe: a study on the residues of discarded syringes in six European cities found that many of the syringes contained new psychoactive substances with stimulant effects.
The use of the new type of psychotropic substance may gradually become established in vulnerable groups.
A new type of spirit-like psychedelic substance has almost never formed a large market.
However, evidence from Europe indicates that synthetic cannabis is a serious problem among marginalized groups such as the homeless and prisoners.
Twenty-two countries have reported on the use of new psychotropic substances in prisons, with the majority of countries identifying synthetic cannabinoids as the main challenge.

The control of precursor chemicals forces drug makers to innovate, and many chemicals used in the production of drugs such as amphetamines, methamphetamine, and "headache pills" have been placed under international control.

The drug dealers and manufacturers are constantly searching for alternative substances that are less regulated, as well as those specifically designed to evade control, known as "specialized precursors."
The measures taken to prevent the spread of the new coronavirus may likely put further pressure on manufacturers of essential chemicals.

Evidence from Mexico indicates that this has become a reality: According to reports, in March 2020, the shortage of intermediate products in East Asia led to a price hike in Mexico and the United States for methamphetamine.
Market volatility.
The synthetic drug is replacing opium in Central Asia and the Russian Federation.
The market for opioids in Central Asia and the Russian Federation appeared to undergo changes from 2008 to 2018.

The quantity of methadone intercepted by Russian authorities has decreased by about 80%, while the number of people receiving treatment for addiction has significantly decreased due to the use of methadone.
However, the excitement of the market seems to be growing steadily.
There is evidence that indicates that MBDB, ketamine, and various cathinones, including methoxetamine and alpha-PV7, are currently visible on the Russian drug market.
According to Russian authorities, the number of secret drug manufacturing sites uncovered recently has sharply increased, with a total of 152 such sites found in 2018 alone.
Afghanistan and Iraq have seen a growth in the market for methylphenidate.
In 2012, a survey of hospital, prison, and other organization staff had already revealed the importance of ketamine in Iraq.
Crystallographic peptide pharmacophores have already become a "worrying" main drug outside of the "Feng Ni Tian Lin" and Qi Ma Du.
In 2015, a study further confirmed these findings, with drug users stating that methamphetamine is more difficult to obtain than either "Fen Ni Tian Lin" or ketamine.

Recently, Iraqi authorities have discovered several methamphetamine production sites, and the drug agency has expressed concern about the large-scale importation of fake ephedrine, which is used as a precursor to methamphetamine.
In Afghanistan, the production of methamphetamine seems to have started around 2014.
Since then, the seizure of methamphetamine has been steadily increasing.
But the seizure volume in the first half of 2019 was 657 kilograms, a significant increase from the previous year.
Large quantities of methamphetamine believed to originate from Afghanistan have been seized in other countries, indicating a rapid increase in production in that country.
Policy changes and trends.
There is a trend of increasing use of marijuana for non-medical purposes in areas where it has been legalized.
Eleven regions in Canada, Uruguay, and the United States allow the production of marijuana products for non-medical use.
In many areas, the use of marijuana has been legalized or decriminalized, although the trend is also observed in other areas where non-medical use of marijuana has not been legalized.

In the two earliest states to legalize marijuana use in the United States, Colorado and Washington, the number of adults using marijuana for non-medical purposes has increased significantly, particularly in the past month and daily or almost daily use, which has exceeded the national average since 2012.
All indicators show that the use of marijuana in Uruguay has increased significantly since 2011, with the latest figures almost doubling last month's usage.
This indicates that the main reason for the increase is frequent and frequent use of marijuana.
According to data from Canada, the short-term trend also shows that the increase in the number of users during the period of legalization (2018-2019) was accompanied by an expansion of the market.
However, in 2019, still 40% of marijuana users obtained some products through illegal sources.
The reason for the sharp decline in the global cannabis confiscation volume after legalization is legalization?
In 2018, the global cannabis seizure volume reached its lowest level in 20 years, due to a decrease in seizures in North America, which had decreased by 84% over the past 10 years.

Comparing with other regions in the world during the same period, the seizure rate in our area has almost doubled. The seizure pattern indicates that the policy of opening up the marijuana market has played a key role in the downward trend.

The regulation of new psychotropic substances seems to have a suppressive effect on the effectiveness of domestic monitoring of new psychotropic substances, making it difficult to evaluate the monitoring effectiveness.
Some countries that have implemented different monitoring systems for new psychotropic substances show different usage patterns for these substances.
In other countries, after domestic legislation has been implemented, the use of new psychotropic substances has decreased.
The main application of pain-relieving and addiction-treatment drugs belonging to the opioid category is unevenly distributed in various regions, with a greater focus on high-income countries.
In 2018, more than 90% of opioid medications used for medical consumption were in high-income countries.
Approximately 50% in North America, 40% in Europe, and 2% in Oceania.
These countries' populations approximate 12% of the global population.
According to estimates, the population of low-income and middle-income countries accounts for 88% of the global population, but the consumption of opioid drugs is only around 10%.
Obstacles in obtaining opioid-based drugs are related to many factors, including legal issues, cultural barriers, healthcare systems, and prescription practices.
The risk of drug addiction is higher for people with lower socioeconomic status, with an estimated 3.56 million people suffering from drug addiction in 2018.

Poverty, limited education, and social marginalization may increase the risk of drug abuse and worsen its consequences. High-income countries have confirmed this, and in these studies, the individual's disadvantageous social economic trajectory, not just their situation at a particular time point, is also related to the risk of drug abuse.

Drug addiction can further exacerbate social economic decline, leading to increased unemployment, poverty, and homelessness, which in turn may be related to the harsh treatment and consequences within the criminal justice system.

Women, ethnic minorities, migrants, LGBTQ+ individuals, and people affected by armed conflicts or natural disasters may also be disproportionately affected by drug addiction, or face difficulties in accessing treatment services.

According to the estimated number of healthy life years lost due to disability and early death caused by addiction, the harmful effects of smoking have become more widespread in society over the past decade.
Between 2007 and 2018, the global disability-adjusted life years (DALYs) due to drug addiction increased by 17%.
The related disability adjusted life years (DALYs) increase of liver cancer caused by hepatitis B virus (HBV) infection, which is commonly injected, is particularly high - up to 40%.
The relationship between drug use and violence is complex and difficult to determine, and there are numerous causal links between the two.
Global data indicates that intoxication may be a significant factor in murder.
However, in violent events, alcohol's effects seem to be greater than those of drugs.

Although drug abuse may lead to crime in some cases, in certain situations, this connection can be attributed to multiple intermediate factors, such as deteriorating social and economic conditions, as well as the influence of individual risk factors, family environment, and peer pressure from one's own age group.
The connection between drug dealing and violence is multi-faceted.
If there is a stable criminal structure, including large-scale organized drug trafficking, it may be possible to implement without violence in certain situations.

Within a short period of time, the level of violence and its impact on the drug trade is determined by the balance of power between rival criminal groups, rather than the quantity of drugs being transported. For example, changes in the scale of illegal markets, the death or imprisonment of notorious criminals, and the implementation of law enforcement measures that weaken one group compared to another can all have an impact.
Trend
Heroin is the most commonly used drug, and its harm is the greatest.
According to estimates, there were 1.92 billion people using marijuana in 2018, making it the most widely used drug globally.
Comparatively, there were 5.8 million people using class A drugs in 2018.
However, the harm related to opioid-type drugs is often overlooked due to the relatively low usage rate.

According to estimates, in 2017, drug abuse-related deaths totaled 167,000 cases, with 66% of them caused by these substances. In terms of lost lifespan due to drug addiction or premature death, there were 2.1 million years of life lost, with 50% of them caused by these substances.
Illegal use of synthetic opioids has exacerbated the public health crisis.

In West and Central Africa, the crisis of drug addiction is exacerbated by khat; in North America, it is fentanyl. These two regions have little in common in terms of economic, population, or drug use statistics, but they are both struggling to combat the easy availability and low production costs of khat and fentanyl.
In North America, the use of fentanyl and other synthetic opioids has led to an increase in opioid-related deaths over the past 20 years.
In 2018, among the 67,367 excess deaths registered in the United States, three-quarters involved fentanyl.
Canada also reported similar results, but with lower numbers.
The excessive deaths caused by Fenproporex (芬太尼) in part can be attributed to the unpredictable side effects of the drug on the illegal drug market.
In Western, Central, and North Africa, the market for non-medical use of horses has seen significant growth.
In this area, the number of patients with chronic diseases who are treated with horse therapy is increasing rapidly.
In 2017, the global capture of rhinos significantly increased, reaching a peak of over 125 tons.
But in 2018, after India implemented a new law regulating the use of plastic bags, the global plastic bag seizure quantity decreased to 32 tons.
The crisis was caused by the simplicity of manufacturing and low production costs, as well as the lack of international regulation on products similar to Tamiflu and its precursors.
The materials that cause the two crises to worsen are supplied on both the legitimate and illegal markets, making it more difficult to detect and prevent their abuse.
The use of stimulants keeps increasing.
The excitement industry primarily utilizes ketamine and methamphetamine, both of which are seeing increasing usage in their primary markets.
In 2018, there were approximately 1.9 million people using cannabis in China, as it is popular in North America and Western Europe.
Approximately 2.7 million people used pyrethroids in the same year, with pyronyl-pyrethroids being the most widely used in Southeast Asia and North America.
According to the majority of indicators, the use of 甲基苯丙胺 in these two regions has been expanding over the past 20 years.

In some markets, calcium and propofol can coexist and sometimes substitute each other, which can cause the usage of one drug to increase while the other drug's usage decreases, or both drugs to increase and decrease simultaneously to meet the demands of the same market.
The risk of infection for those who were injected with the drug has increased due to the new coronavirus.
According to estimates, there were approximately 113 million people who injected drugs in 2018, and around 10% of global HIV infections were caused by injection drug use.
More than 100 million people have been infected with HIV through injection drug use, and there are 550 million people who have contracted hepatitis B.

In 2017, there were approximately 58.5 million deaths due to drug abuse, with half of them dying from liver disease caused by hepatitis B infection, and most of the injecting drug users with hepatitis B infection still lacked proper treatment.
The shortage of opioids caused by the restrictions on new coronavirus may lead users to turn to alcohol or synthetic drugs that are easier to obtain, or to mix opioids with other medications.
As some users start to inject or use the drug more frequently, possibly more harmful use methods will emerge.

The EU summit is debating refugee policies, with EU officials saying that the reception process is a bottleneck - China News.
The European Union has been persistently advocating for refugee policies, EU officials: Every step of the reception process is bottlenecked.

According to a report by the Global Times on February 10th, during the latest EU summit, the EU Chairman, von der Leyen, stated that the EU leaders have agreed to adopt stricter policies on illegal immigration, making it easier to expel illegal immigrants.

According to reports, the EU's move is a response to the growing issue of illegal immigration in Europe, and the core problem for the EU is that the number of illegal immigrants who can be deported is very small.

According to the peak meeting documents, the EU leaders called on the committee to "immediately mobilize a large amount of EU funds" using infrastructure and monitoring measures to strengthen the external border.
However, the EU and each member state are still arguing over the cost of fencing.
Fang Deleon once again expressed that the EU funding will not pay related fees.

Some member states' diplomats claimed that if the EU could share the burden of installing surveillance cameras, observation towers, and other infrastructure along its external borders, it would free up national budgets and accelerate the construction process.

According to Euractiv website, European Union officials have acknowledged that there are bottlenecks in every step of the refugee reception process, with limited reception capacity and member states unable to prevent refugees from submitting "hundreds" of asylum applications in each EU country, putting the EU's refugee reception system in a near-permanent crisis.
According to the European Commission's estimates, last year, the Schengen countries received over 92,000 asylum applications, an increase of nearly half compared to the previous year.
At the same time, the EU recorded over 33 million illegal border crossings last year.
In this context, this peak meeting has achieved an agreement on a "principle" that EU member states can repatriate illegal immigrants based on a judicial decision of another member state.
According to reports, the EU leaders also agreed to "increase the use of the concept of 'safe countries'", which will pave the way for the EU to establish a common list.
The source is from Global Times, written by Ni Yuefeng.

Recently, the United States has been stepping up its efforts to contain China's semiconductor industry - first, the Netherlands and Japan under pressure from the US agreed to start controlling the export of semiconductor manufacturing equipment to China; later, media reports revealed that the US government is considering cutting off all ties between US suppliers and Huawei, banning US suppliers from providing any products to Huawei; and the Biden administration is preparing to release an executive order limiting investment by US companies in sensitive Chinese technology industries... The US has been relentless in its efforts to suppress China's semiconductor-related industries in 2023.

In recent years, the United States has not stopped its actions to suppress China's "core" development, precisely targeting China's semiconductor supply chain and constructing a "de-China" alliance of semiconductor industries, with the goal of completely "breaking away" from China in the advanced semiconductor industry.

Here is the translation of the given Chinese text into English:

Regardless of whether it is establishing a "technical alliance" with South Korea, forming a "quadrilateral alliance" with Japan, China, and Taiwan, or leveraging the "four-way mechanism" and "Indo-Pacific economic framework" to build a semiconductor industry chain, the United States is attempting to establish a closed supply chain loop by using politicized, militarized, and weaponized means to introduce semiconductor industries, with the goal of maintaining its leading position in the chip manufacturing sector and making up for its shortcomings in this field.
However, the US's grandiose "soft power" tactics towards China are actually a "hurt-your-enemy-a-thousand-times-while-hurting-yourself-eight-hundred" strategy.

Global leader ASM International has recently warned against exporting semiconductor manufacturing equipment to China, which may lead to a price hike in semiconductors.

The United States' suppression of China's advanced semiconductor industry has dragged down the global semiconductor supply chain and industry chain.

Although the US semiconductor industry has a strong foundation, it is relatively weak in terms of manufacturing capabilities and advanced process technologies, and relies heavily on the East Asian region.

Even if the United States exerts great efforts to guide the advanced chip supply chain towards its own "little circles" of regional development, it is difficult to change the distribution and interdependence of the global semiconductor industry.
The United States has been strengthening its efforts to "reshape" and "de-Chinese" the semiconductor industry chain, causing significant damage to the global semiconductor industry.
The chip is the core of the global industry, and the development of the chip industry cannot be separated from the joint participation of countries around the world.

In recent years, the United States has taken a series of unilateral actions, including the "Innovation and Competition Act," "the 2022 US Competition Act," and the "Chip and Science Act," using technological superiority to consolidate its leading position in the field of semiconductors. It has coerced its allies, such as Intel, Taiwan, and Samsung, to set up factories in the United States, and has made great efforts to ensure that the United States maintains its global leadership in the semiconductor industry.
In the short term, the US has indeed caused trouble for China's chip industry and related industries, but has also reaped real benefits.

But in the long run, the US has been steadily suppressing China's chip industry, forcing China to constantly break through its own barriers, causing itself to lose a huge market in China, ultimately weakening the innovation intentions and capabilities of US tech companies, and harming the overall development of the global chip industry.

"First batch of personal pension wealth management products launched, with the shortest holding period of 360 days - China News"
First batch of personalized elderly care financial products available for sale.
The seven products of the home appliance can be chosen, and the shortest warranty period is 360 days.
The personal wealth management product finally went online.

February 10th, China Finance Network released the first batch of personal pension investment products list, with 7 personal pension investment products of China Merchants Bank, China Construction Bank, and China Postal Savings Bank officially launched.

So, the individual elderly care savings account "shopping cart" has finally been filled with the individual elderly care savings, personal elderly care financial management, personal elderly care insurance, and personal elderly care public fundraising four types of products.

According to introductions, the first batch of individual pension assets, all of which are open-ended and pure value-added products, consist of 5 new products and 2 existing products. Among them, 1 product is a mixed type product, while the remaining 6 products are fixed income type products.

According to a report by a Beijing youth newspaper, among the 5 newly launched products, 4 of them come from Industrial and Commercial Bank of China, and they are all fixed-income products with the shortest maturity period of 365 days, 540 days, 720 days, and 1080 days, respectively. The corresponding performance is relatively better (yearly basis) with returns of 3.70% - 4.20%, 4.10% - 4.60%, 4.40% - 4.90%, and 5.25% - 5.75%.

The remaining new product is "Email Fortune 1095 Days", a fixed income product with a maturity period of 1095 days. The subscription period starts on February 10th and ends on February 19th, and the risk level is classified as Level 2.
The two surviving products among them are "Farmer's Gold 'Synergy 360' Technological Innovation Product" with a mix of investment nature and risk level of Class 3.

Another product is "Email Fortune 365 Days 1.0011", a fixed-income type, which started collecting funds on December 30, 2022, and officially launched on January 4, 2023. As of February 8, the cumulative net value is 1.0011.

According to the Opinion of the State Council on Promoting the Development of Individual Pension Funds, the investment scope of individual pension fund accounts includes bank deposits, savings deposits, commercial pension insurance, and public fundraising.

The first batch of personalized elderly care financial products was sold, marking the official launch of personalized elderly care investment, where investors can now purchase financial products through their personalized elderly care fund accounts.
The Insurance Regulatory Commission established the "Temporary Measures for the Management of Individual Pension Business of Commercial Banks and Insurance Companies" in November last year.

According to the regulations, participants can purchase personal elderly care savings, personal elderly care financial products, personal elderly care insurance products, and personal elderly care crowdfunding fund products through their personal elderly care savings accounts.

Afterward, the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Security, the Ministry of Finance, and the State Taxation Administration jointly issued a notice, clearly stating that the personal pension system will be implemented in Beijing, Tianjin, and 36 other pilot cities and regions, including Hebei Shijiazhuang, Shanxi Jinzhong, and Shaanxi Xi'an.

As of the end of 2022, the number of individuals participating in the individual pension insurance program was 1954 million, with 613 million paying premiums and a total premium amounting to 142 billion yuan.
Prior to this, participating banks only offered three types of products: personal pension insurance, personal pension savings, and personal pension crowdfunding.
Currently, with the accumulation of personal pension and wealth management products, investors should how to choose?

According to the expert from the asset management department of the bank, compared to other individual pension products, the pilot stage of the elderly financial products and the individual elderly financial products both have three aspects in common.
One is stability, with a more comprehensive risk management mechanism, investment strategies and concepts are more stable, and third-party independent management is implemented.

The second is long-term, and the trial period for elderly care financial products with a term of 5 years or more has been set, while the minimum holding period for individual elderly care financial products is 1 year, with a preference for holding them for 3 years or more.

Three is the affordability, the product purchase threshold is low, the starting point is generally 1 yuan, and some are as low as 0.01 yuan, and the fees for product storage and management are more discounted.
According to professional experts, investors should base their selection on the product's characteristics and their own risk tolerance.

Here is the translation of the given Chinese text:

"Personal retirement savings plans have a longer time horizon, higher returns, and higher safety compared to other types of insurance products. They are suitable for individuals with limited investment risk tolerance, such as the elderly or those who are unable to bear investment risks. Personal retirement savings plans prioritize protection, and their expected returns are relatively higher than other investment products. However, they also have investment risks, and are suitable for individuals with certain financial knowledge and risk tolerance. On the other hand, personal retirement savings plans and mutual funds do not guarantee returns, and their expected returns are higher than other investment products. They are suitable for individuals with a certain level of financial knowledge and risk tolerance."

"The fitness industry should shake off trust crisis - China News"
Is another large-scale gym "thunderbolt"?
Recently, the issue of member rights abuse in a well-known fitness organization has attracted social attention.

After the Spring Festival, many members found that their door-to-door businesses were not operating normally, and rumors about the organization's closure caused panic among members, leading to the involvement of public security and social welfare departments.
Finally, the responsible person from the organization appeared and promised to make efforts to ensure the legal rights of employees and members, only then did the situation calm down.
Why do some members' first reaction to the temporary closure of a part of the gym's branches due to operational issues is "it's no big deal"?
The behind-the-scenes turmoil surrounding the fitness club member rights protection movement is a deep-seated issue of industry trust crisis.
The traditional gyms in China generally adopt a prepaid model, and the logic behind it is to earn money from users who don't come.
Through pre-sale membership cards, he obtained cash flow, constantly opening new stores, but in reality, he was just digging his own grave, unable to establish a stable profit model.
The negative news about the fitness industry, such as the running room scandal, has had a strong impact on consumer confidence.
From the market perspective, a gym is definitely a good business with a "money-making" potential.
Although the fitness industry has its ups and downs, it is always under capitalist scrutiny.
Multiple data shows that the heat of consumption in the cultural and entertainment sector is continuously rising, and the market is warming up.
In the fitness market, as residents' living standards steadily improve, the concept of healthy living deeply ingrained in people's minds, and the fitness industry has great potential for growth.
The situation becomes more favorable, and the industry pays more attention to the quality of development.

However, some organizations are blindly optimistic about the fitness market after the consumption has been revived, just coming out of the crisis, and they are blowing their own trumpets, pouring all their funds into new store construction with no regard for caution.

It cannot be denied that the past few years have been affected by the epidemic, and many organizations have withdrawn, causing the industry to undergo a thorough cleaning and rebranding. Strong enterprises have chosen to increase their acquisition capacity and reorganize their layouts, and it is not uncommon for them to seize new opportunities.
However, to develop the health market and enter a positive cycle, the industry must change its traditional mode of operation and business strategy.
Only through steady and persistent efforts to rebuild consumer trust and safety, can we truly win the market and the future.

Compared to opening a new store and grabbing market share, the health and fitness industry currently needs to focus on cultivating a down-to-earth attitude and optimizing services with high-quality development to stabilize users.
First, we need to keep the user.

The gym belongs to the service industry, its essence is to adhere to the user-oriented approach, to closely surround the needs of users, and to place the focus of operations on improving service quality.
Next, it is necessary to rely on digital transformation to enhance user experience.
Like the current popular internet fitness room mode, users can pay per session and choose their own location.
At the same time, the body data and exercise data can be effectively utilized, and social needs can be satisfied, realizing a complete service loop from online to offline.
There is no private coaching or large membership fees, which has reduced the users' worries about running to fitness facilities and thus increased their trust in these institutions.
"In addition, it is also important to actively explore multiple business models."

Currently, sports consumption has evolved from single-service consumption to scene-based consumption, and fitness clubs may become a new consumption entry point. Surrounding fitness needs and sports equipment, such as sports nutrition and sports gear, may become a new profit point for consumers, providing more diverse choices.
Yang Tianye

"Nanjing Building 'Overcharging' Incident Repeats Itself - China News"

According to a report by Yangtze Evening News (reporter Ma Zhibo), a "保价协议" that had not been seen for over ten years has reappeared in Nanjing, a residential complex in the Jiangbei New Area claims to offer "discounts" to buyers, and the developer is willing to switch homes and return the difference to the buyers.
"The conditions of the '保价协议' are not few."

This apartment complex located in the Jingnan New Area is called the Baoliang Yanshun Tower. According to Mr. Sun, a resident of the complex, he discovered a statement last weekend when he was browsing the complex's website.

He showed the reporters the pictures of the developer's promise, which stated that for those who purchased properties between February 1st and 28th, the developer would provide a discount of up to 10% of the purchase price if the discounts of other properties in the same type, floor, unit, and property type were higher than the previous purchase price.

Mr. Sun expressed that the purpose of the consultation is to provide a "price guarantee" for the buyer, allowing them to feel at ease and not worry about the developer reducing the price or promoting the project, as they may worry that if they buy it now, the price will be reduced later, and it will be too late to complain.
Some people who buy houses think that the "price protection agreement" is like a "sweet poison" that gives homebuyers a false sense of security, but the conditions are not lenient.

The woman in Jingning said, "When buying a new house, the first thing I look for is the same floor plan, same building, and same unit. Since the buyer can only compare a limited number of houses, the threshold is quite high."
Some buyers believe that due to the asymmetry of information, sellers may provide additional benefits during the sale, making it difficult for buyers to assert their rights.
Can the buyer observe the property.

Journalist finds through online property search in Nanjing that the building has a total of 252 apartment units, with sizes ranging from 105 square meters to 129 square meters, and the fully furnished apartment prices are all 39843 yuan per square meter.

It has been about two months since the online real estate platform showed that the total number of unsold units in the building is 157, accounting for 62.3%, with 8th floor having 128 unsold units and a total of 113 unsold units, and 7th floor having 124 unsold units with 44 units yet to be sold, and the total transactional units only account for 33 units, which is only 13%.
Market observers introduced that the "price-fixing agreement" also appeared in Nanjing in 2008.

In August of that year, the housing estate on Huang Mountain Road in the west of the city launched a "Price Guarantee Plan" to attract buyers, which promised to refund the difference to old homeowners if the project's discounts increased within a year.
After 2011 April, Nanjing also had 9 buildings that promised to pay the difference in price.
"The city is warming up, and now we need a 'heart medication' more than ever."
Mr. Shen, a seasoned industry insider from Nanjing, stated that "price agreements" are also a marketing strategy used by real estate companies.
He believes that nowadays, starting a business is more important than buying a house, and releasing the "price guarantee agreement" is actually a way to give it a boost.
Whether he can keep the buyers, he says it depends on the impact of multiple factors such as monetary policy and loan thresholds, and it's still under observation at present.
Multiple data points indicate a decline in Taiwan's economic performance - Central News Agency.

According to a report by Xinhua News Agency on February 11th (reporters Zhao Bo and Huang Yong), the export value of Taiwan's foreign trade in January reached a new low, with the PMI (Purchasing Managers' Index) for manufacturing purchasing managers continuously contracting for 7 months, and the Consumer Price Index (CPI) seeing a "3-digit" increase... Recently, Taiwanese authorities have released January 2023 economic data.
According to experts, Taiwan's economic performance this year has been poor, with significant growth pressure.

According to the statistics released by the Financial and Economic Affairs Bureau of the Taiwan authorities, Taiwan's exports in January amounted to USD 315.1 billion, down 21.2% year-on-year, marking the fifth consecutive month of decline.
Eleven major export categories of goods showed a decline in export value compared to the same period last year.
The plastic products and optical components dropped the most, with a decrease of 37.6% and 35.7%, respectively.
Electronic component exports decreased by 20.1% in one year, the largest decline in 11 years.
The integration of circuits decreased by 18.3% last year, the largest decline in 14 years.
The department's statistics head, Cao Mei, said that this shows that the consumer electronics industry is experiencing a weak demand effect, and the industry is entering a corrective period.
According to statistics, the exports and imports of Taiwan's January region decreased simultaneously, with exports only reaching $23.4 billion, the lowest level in nearly 3 years.

The Taiwanese authorities in charge of financial and economic affairs believe that global demand for terminals will decrease, and the industry will adjust inventory supply to restrain manufacturers from purchasing raw materials, which will lead to a short-term decline in exports and a worsening of the situation in the first quarter of this year.
According to the Taiwan Institute of Economic Research, the Taiwan Manufacturing PMI (PMI) in January was 40.4%, down 3.3 percentage points from the previous month and down 7 consecutive months.
In the economic monitoring index system, PMI is set at 50% as the turning point, with an index value above 50% indicating an expansionary economy and vice versa.
January Taiwan PMI (Purchasing Managers' Index) composed of five components, including new orders, production, employment, supplier delivery time, and inventory.

The six major industries' total return on investment (ROI) contracted, with the electrical and mechanical equipment industry (35.1%), electronic and optical industry (35.2%), chemical and biotechnology industry (39.2%), basic raw material industry (42.4%), transportation equipment industry (42.6%), and food and textile industry (45.7%) ranked in order of their contraction rates.

The Consumer Price Index (CPI) in Taiwan was announced by the "Mainland Price Bureau" of the Taiwan authorities, with a year-on-year increase of 3.04% in January, which is the second consecutive time it has exceeded 3% since July last year.
The price of vegetables has surged by 28.25%, setting a new high in 17 months.

"The head of the Price Bureau, Zhang Xiaoming, spoke frankly, saying that the price increase is indeed higher than expected, excluding the impact of the Spring Festival, the average CPI in January and February is expected to be close to 2.71% of last December, and inflation pressure still exists and is at a high level."
According to reports from local media such as United Daily News and Yahoo Finance, as well as expert opinions, the outlook for Taiwan's economy this year is grim.
Professor Wu of the Economics Department of Central University analyzed that the decline in exports may cause cash flow problems for manufacturers, leading to an increase in debt default risks.

At the same time, the reduction in orders has led to manufacturers reducing their workforce, which has an impact on the labor market and family economics, ultimately affecting consumption capabilities.

Dr. Huang of the Institute of Economic Research at Taiwan believes that the inflation situation in Europe and the US will not be resolved this year, and the demand will continue to shrink, estimating that Taiwan's exports will continue to decline until the second half of the year.
Due to Taiwan's economy relying on exports, the impact of low exports will affect the entire year's economic growth, which will not be as good as last year.

Report: Number of 2022 Returning Overseas Students Reaches New High - China News

According to the 2022 China Returned Overseas Students Employment Survey Report, the top 10 sources of job information for returned overseas students in China are:

1. University career services
2. Online job platforms
3. Networking events
4. Recruitment agencies
5. Company websites
6. Job fairs
7. Professional associations
8. Alumni associations
9. Social media
10. Government websites.

According to the latest report released by China New Net Beijing on February 11th (Chen Rong), the 2022 China Returned Overseas Talent Employment Survey Report (hereinafter referred to as "the Report") shows that the scale of 2022 graduates has increased by 8.6% compared to the previous year, with the number of returned overseas students reaching a new high, and Chinese enterprises are facing an increasing demand for overseas talent.
According to the report, since 2020, the number of overseas returnees in China has significantly increased, with a notable increase in the number of graduates who are returning to seek employment.
Comparing 2021 to 2022, the scale of outbound students has increased by 8.6% with a new high in the number of returning students seeking employment.

According to the distribution of study-abroad students from returning Chinese students, the UK has the highest percentage, accounting for 41.4%, followed by Australia (20.3%) and the US (9%). The ranking is consistent with that of 2021.
According to comparative growth rates, the number of graduate students from Malaysia, Japan, and Singapore has seen a sharp increase, with growth rates of 66.1%, 50.9%, and 37.7%, respectively.
The number of international students from Canada, Germany, the United States, and Australia has been declining.
After the Chinese New Year in 2023, the demand for skilled workers in the sea and shipping industry will trend upward, according to the 2022 China Sea and Shipping Employment Survey Report.

The hope of finding survivors in the areas affected by the earthquake in Turkey and Syria has been gradually fading away over the past few days, but the rescue of a family of five on Saturday brought immense relief to search and rescue personnel.

A man holding a cat he just rescued.

According to official statistics, the earthquake on Monday in Turkey has resulted in over 2,000 deaths, with estimates of the number of deaths in neighboring Syria exceeding 3,500.

Rescue personnel are still searching for signs of life using thermal imaging equipment under the rubble.

UN official: The disaster in that area is a "once-in-a-lifetime" calamity.

Chilean Earthquake (1960)
May 22nd, 1960 at 3:11 pm local time, a magnitude 9.5 earthquake occurred in Valdivia, Chile, which is the largest recorded earthquake in human history.
In just a few minutes, Valdivia was reduced to ruins.
After the earthquake, a massive tsunami attacked the coast of Chile, with wave heights reaching 25 meters tall.
The tsunami reached distant Japan and the Philippines.
The number of casualties and economic losses caused by the disaster cannot be accurately estimated.
The most destructive earthquake to occur globally over the past 60 years.
Alaska earthquake (1964)
March 27, 1964 was a Friday, which is also the day of Jesus' crucifixion.
This day, the United States Alaska experienced the largest earthquake in North American history, with a magnitude of 9.2.
Until 2006, the Alaska earthquake was still recorded as the third largest earthquake in history.
During an earthquake, a fault between the Pacific Plate and the North American Plate near the William Wilson Fault in the area near the Bay of Islands broke.
The earthquake lasted 3 to 5 minutes in most areas.
The sea bed subsidence triggered a massive tsunami, reaching a height of 67 meters.
Because it was a holiday, so the school and many companies were closed.
This earthquake finally led to the deaths of 139 people.
Twenty-two people died directly due to the earthquake, while 130 others died as a result of the tsunami triggered by the earthquake.
The most destructive earthquake to occur globally over the past 60 years.
The Great Tangshan Earthquake (1976)
July 28, 1976, two strong earthquakes of magnitude 7 or higher occurred in Tangshan, Hebei Province, China, within a 16-hour period.
The epicenter is 23 kilometers away from the ground.
The entire transportation, communication, water and electricity in Tianjin City were cut off, and the situation was brought to a standstill.
The capital city Beijing, located 140 kilometers away, also felt strong tremors.
According to official statistics, including Beijing and Tianjin, all affected areas in the earthquake have resulted in 242,769 deaths and 164,851 injuries.
The Tangshan earthquake became the second deadliest earthquake in Chinese history, second only to the Great Earthquake of 1556.
However, some foreign scientists estimate that this earthquake may have caused at least 65,000 deaths.
The most destructive earthquake to occur globally over the past 60 years.
Indian Ocean earthquake (2004)
December 26, 2004, a earthquake occurred in the West Coast of Indonesia's Aceh Province, with a depth of 30 kilometers and a magnitude of 9.1 to 9.3.
The earthquake triggered a massive wave of up to 15 to 30 meters in height.

The Pacific coast of 14 countries was affected by the tsunami, with the most severely affected areas including Aceh province in Indonesia, Phang Nga and Krabi provinces in Thailand, Sri Lanka, and Tamil Nadu in India.

During the peak tourist season of Christmas, many tourists and local residents had gathered in the disaster-stricken area, causing many tourists enjoying their beach vacation and local people working on the beach to be swept away by the tsunami, resulting in many people becoming missing.
According to estimates, the number of deceased and missing persons is at least 30,000.
The most destructive earthquake to occur globally over the past 60 years.
Wenchuan earthquake (2008)
May 12, 2008, a major earthquake occurred in Sichuan Province, China.

According to the data from the China Earthquake Administration, this earthquake had a magnitude of 8.2 on the surface wave scale and 8.3 on the moment magnitude scale, and caused damage to an area exceeding 10,000 square kilometers.

As of September 25, 2008, the earthquake had caused 69,227 deaths, 17,923 missing persons, 374,643 people with different levels of injuries, 199,300 people who lost their homes, and the total population affected was 4,625.6 million.
It is the most destructive earthquake since the founding of the People's Republic of China, and the deadliest one after the Tangshan earthquake.

March 2009, the Chinese State Council announced that May 12th of each year would be designated as Disaster Prevention and Reduction Day, with increased focus on educating the public and enhancing disaster prevention and reduction work.
Afterward, many Chinese government and elementary schools hold earthquake drills on this day every year.
The primary and middle schools also start to pay more attention to the implementation of "earthquake prevention and reduction" education.

January 12, 2010, a magnitude 7.0 earthquake occurred in Haiti.
The epicenter of the earthquake is located 25 kilometers west-southwest of the capital city of Haiti, with the epicenter at a depth of approximately 13 kilometers below the surface.
The International Red Cross estimates that the population affected by the earthquake is approximately 300 million.
The government of Haiti has confirmed more than 20,000 deaths.
Some areas within Haiti have seen destruction of up to 90% of their housing due to earthquakes.
Although international society has provided a large amount of aid and support, this poverty-stricken country has never recovered from the disaster.
The most destructive earthquake to occur globally over the past 60 years.
The Great East Japan Earthquake (2011)
March 11, 2011, a magnitude 9.0 large-scale earthquake occurred in the northeastern region of Japan offshore.

The epicenter of the earthquake was located in the Pacific Ocean, east of the capital city of Xi'an, Shaanxi Province, with a depth of 24 kilometers and causing the largest tsunami with a height of 40.1 meters.
This earthquake is the first one in Japan to exceed a magnitude of 9 since records began.
Approximately 2.2 million people were killed or injured, and around 40 million buildings were completely destroyed or collapsed.
The Fukushima Daiichi nuclear power plant was affected by the earthquake and tsunami and suffered a leakage accident.
This incident has been classified as the most severe level 7 in the International Nuclear Event Scale (INES).
The Fukushima nuclear accident led to the detection of trace amounts of radioactive materials, including iodine-131 and cesium-137 (half-life of 30 years), worldwide.
The radioactive elements were thus released into the Pacific Ocean.
According to UN statistics, at least 870,000 people in the two disaster-stricken areas urgently need food.
Approximately 530 million people in Syria have lost their homes due to earthquakes.
The World Food Programme (WFP) appealed for $7.7 million in funding to provide food assistance to the displaced people in Turkey and Syria affected by the earthquake.
The current temperature in the disaster zone is as low as minus 20 degrees Celsius, and many survivors do not have shelter.
The Turkish government distributed a large quantity of blankets, tents, and food, but these supplies still had difficulty reaching many people in urgent need of help.
In Syria, which has been embroiled in a civil war for 12 years, the earthquake has only made the people's suffering more severe.
After the earthquake occurred within four days, the World Food Programme had provided food aid to 11.5 million people in Turkey and Syria.
The World Health Organization (WHO) sent 72 tons of medical supplies for external injuries and emergency surgery.

Police Alert: Citizens Urged to Be Cautious of Fraudulent Short Messages from Telecom Companies

Recently, our police station has received numerous reports of telephone scams, where fraudsters posing as employees of our telecom company send text messages with a website link to victims, pretending to offer a prize or reward in exchange for immediate action, and then tricking the victims into logging into a fake website to claim their prize.

The cardholder inputs their credit card information and verification code according to the instructions, and then receives a notice from the financial institution that an unknown transaction record has appeared on their card, suspected to be due to their card information being stolen through the above website.
According to the investigation, it has been confirmed that the relevant telecommunications company did not issue the above short message.

The police are urging citizens to be vigilant and not to provide any personal information, including credit card details, account transaction passwords, or verification codes, even if they receive similar short messages.
"Alert: 🚨"
"Mulitple attention to network security information, enhance personal defense awareness."
Do not casually enter unverified websites and register personal information such as credit card details to avoid being stolen.
Be cautious of fake websites and phishing sites, and always check whether the website address matches the official website completely.
"Install anti-virus software on mobile devices, computers, and update it regularly."
Suspect fraud or other crimes? Please immediately call the police hotline 8800-7777 or report to the hotline 993 for assistance.

Kim Jong-un's father and daughter have a close interaction, while his wife is ignored.

The Korean government released a video on the 9th, showing Kim Jong-un bowing down beside his father's body, whispering and speaking softly to him, gently cradling his father's face with both hands, even touching his father's chest, and the heartwarming interaction between the father and daughter was broadcasted throughout the country.

North Korean media "released footage of a military parade after the event, revealing more intimate scenes of father and daughter."

Kim Jong-un looked at his daughter several times on the podium with a smile on his face, and the two of them whispered to each other in each other's ears, Kim Jong-un once picked up his father's cheeks with both hands and smiled back at him.

Other media also showed that Kim Jong-un and Kim Yo-jong were sitting on a sofa inside the room, constantly touching their father's face with their hands; when they walked hand in hand with their father, they would also touch his chest with their hands.

How to view the recent unexpectedly high US non-farm employment data in January and the future trend - Economic Observer, a professional financial news website.

Sure, here's the translation:

"Please ask about the view of Renyang Investment on the January non-farm employment data in the United States exceeding expectations and the future trend."

Here is the translation of the Chinese text:

On February 3rd, the US Labor Department released the January 2023 non-farm employment data, with a new increase of 51.7 million non-farm jobs, significantly higher than the market expectation of 18.9 million; the unemployment rate dropped to 3.4%, the lowest in nearly 50 years; and the hourly wage growth rate was 4.4%, slightly slower than the previous month's growth rate of 0.3%.

From a quantitative perspective, there are many one-time and technical factors that have caused fluctuations in this data, such as the return of striking teachers, the adjustment of survey statistics, and the update of seasonal factors. In the future, there may be further adjustments (referring to the recent downward revision of non-agricultural employment from 50.4 million to 36.4 million in January 2022). Non-agricultural employment or unemployment data may be more robust than it appears.

From a structural perspective, high-tech enterprises have seen a more limited impact from layoffs, but the proportion is relatively low; while the service industry, particularly leisure hotels, education and healthcare, have seen a significant increase in new job additions, with labor shortages still persisting in the service sector.

Combining the same high expectations for service sector PMI, job vacancy and labor shortage data, as well as consumption credit data, we judge that the US service industry has recovered rapidly after the extreme weather and holidays.
We believe that the tight supply of labor in the US job market cannot be improved without a decline in the economy.

Currently, there are approximately 500 million labor shortages in the US labor market, and the participation rate of the labor force is slowing down, particularly among workers aged 25-54, whose participation rate has already reached a level close to that before the epidemic.
Except for this, the strong savings and consumption credit of Americans will further hinder the impact of tightening policies on the labor market.
The tight labor market supply in the US will be the bottom line of the US economy in 2023.
The recent surge in interest rates has repeatedly raised inflation expectations, and we are not optimistic about the continued decrease in our salaries.
Before this data is released, the US stock market has overly optimistic expectations for the Fed's rate hiking path.

As inflation data continues to improve, the Federal Reserve is simultaneously shortening the pace of interest rate hikes while maintaining a delicate balance between inflation expectations and market expectations, but the market is not seeing the Fed's hawkish stance, not only expecting an earlier end to rate hikes, but also expecting two rate cuts by the end of the year.

In the context of tight labor market supply and demand, we believe that the Fed's year-end interest rate guidance is relatively reasonable, but the market's extreme expectations and adjustments, as well as the congestion in trading, may cause some harm to the market.

Although it is difficult to change the trend of slowing inflation despite the recent improvement in wage growth, with the M2 data turning negative and various CPI sub-indices showing gradual improvements, the US CPI data has been steadily declining since October, and the persistence of wage growth will only serve as a foundation for future inflation data, and the current market expectations are difficult to verify, after the release of the next inflation data, the market may enter a new round of speculation.

"The 'E-account' has arrived: The securities regulator has authorized the development of a platform for investors to consolidate and query their holdings of all funds under their names - Economic Observer (Chinese language newspaper) - Professional financial news website."
The reporter Chen Mei from Economic Observer Network: Is the complex purchase channel of mutual funds causing difficulties in reconciling account information?
Always forget "small safe"?
The problems of the common people will soon be resolved.
February 10th, the regulatory body announced that the "E-Fund Account" app was launched on various mobile app stores and opened for public testing.

According to the introduction, "基金E账户" provides a "one-stop" query service for personal investors to obtain information on public fund accounts and subscription quotas, with the aim of resolving the pain points of forgetful accounts and cumbersome queries in the industry.

According to Wind data, as of the end of 2022, there were 156 domestic asset management firms managing public funds with a total scale of around 26 trillion yuan; 167 registration agencies for public fundraising, and 411 distribution agencies.
Each department's accounting system is independent and lacks an industry-wide query channel.
According to industry insiders, by the end of 2021, China's mutual fund investors had exceeded 7.2 billion, which means that half of the country's population has invested in mutual fund products.

Prior to that, investors need to query the purchase situation through different sales channels, but through "Fund E-account," they can query the purchase situation of all sales channels at a glance, and have a clear understanding of the fund situation.
"What is the '基金E账户' app?"

Labor Union Against Government Retirement Reform Rallies Big March

Saturday, February 11th (2nd week of February), French unions again launched a nationwide protest against the government's pension reform draft, calling on citizens to take to the streets to express their opinions.
This is the fourth action day of the social movement against the government's pension reform draft.
The number of citizens responding to the rally call may affect the union's next action plan.

This has been a month-long effort by the eight major labor unions in France, who have come together for the fourth time to mobilize the nation, and it is the first time that the protest will be held on a Saturday.

Given that for most French people, Saturday is a weekend day off, they don't need to attend the protest and strike activities on this day, but rather make a choice between participating in the protest and taking a day off work, the union hopes that today's gathering activity can attract more people to participate.

The public transportation system, including the subway and public railways, as well as their employee unions, have not called for strikes today, and the public transportation should operate normally, allowing citizens to take buses or trains to the gathering point. Meanwhile, in areas where schools have started their winter breaks, people can go on their usual holiday trips.

The labor union hopes that today's gathering will have over 100 million participants, while the police expect the total number of participants nationwide to be between 60 million and 80 million, with possibly 900,000 to 1.2 million people gathering in the Paris area.

Since the start of the protests against the pension reform plan, although public opinion polls show that most French people do not support pushing back the mandatory retirement age from the current 62 to 64, the number of people actually taking to the streets has gradually decreased.
The first strike demonstration activity on January 31st gathered 127,000 to 250,000 people across the nation.
The protest crowd on Wednesday (February 7th) has already shrunk to between 750,000 and 200,000 people nationwide.
The pension reform plan is currently being discussed in the French National Assembly.
In the opposition, particularly the radical left-wing opposition parties, have submitted numerous amendments, resulting in a slow and sluggish legislative process.
The debate between the two camps is becoming increasingly intense.

A left-wing radical political party in France recently sparked controversy by posting a picture of a soccer ball with a cartoon image of the labor minister on it on social media, which was seen as disrespectful to the government.
The chairperson of the National People's Congress announced that the member would be banned from participating in parliamentary activities for 15 days as punishment for their behavior.

Although this reform plan has triggered the largest social movement in France over the past 20 years, the government has made only minor adjustments to the draft so far, but has not made any significant concessions.
The union has already prepared to take action again on next Friday, March 16th, which is the day when the draft reform plan will be submitted to the Senate for discussion.

The 7.8-magnitude earthquake that occurred on Monday (April 1st) in Turkey and Syria has triggered several strong aftershocks, making it the seventh deadliest natural disaster of this century, surpassing the 2011 earthquake and tsunami in Japan and the 2003 earthquake in Iran that caused 31,000 deaths.
In 1999, a similar strong earthquake occurred in the northwestern part of Turkey, resulting in the deaths of over 17,000 people.
